title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
OB: When using the new class wizard for nested classes, the 'Enclosing Type' field is not defaulting to the current type in the editor
EB: When a .java file is open in the editor and the new class button is clicked, the 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor
SR:
1. Open a .java file in the editor
2. Click the new class button
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field
4. Verify that it is blank
5. It should default to the current type in the editor
